text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm GJ a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Melbourne
today I'm going to show you how to use
SSL or transport layer security from
your application to encrypt a connection
to a database instance running MySQL or
Microsoft SQL Server let's get started
SSL tless connections provide a layer of
security by encrypting data that
transfer between your client and the
database instance a server certificate
provides another layer of security by
validating that the connection is to an
Amazon RDS database instance when you
provision a database instance Amazon RDS
creates an SSL certificate and then
installs the certificates on the
instance these certificates are signed
by a certificate Authority SSL
certificate includes the database
instance endpoint as a common name for
the SSL certificate that is used to
protect the instance against spoofing
Attacks An SSL certificate created by
Amazon RDS is a trusted Roo entity and
works in most cases however if your
application doesn't accept certificate
chains then the certificate might fail
in such cases you might need to use an
intermediate certificate to connect to
your AWS region for example you must use
an intermediate certificate to connect
to the AWS gol Cloud regions using
SSL Amazon Rd is for mysq
my SQL client programs attempt to
establish an encrypted connection if the
server supports encrypted connections
for additional security relative to that
provided by default encryption use the
hash SSL # CA parameter to reference the
SSL certificate that includes the
database instance endpoint as the common
name the SSL certificate guards the
instance against poofing
attacks after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the
Amazon RDS console then select the mySQL
database instance that you want to
connect to from the connectivity and
security tab of the instance copy the
endpoint
details if you're using RDS for MySQL
version 5.7 or 8.0 with the performance
schema turned on and you have
applications connected to your database
instance run the following query to
check for connections that are using SSL
D
list Amazon audius for SQL Server you
can use use only one of these ways to
use SSL to connect to your SQL Server
database instance Force SSL for all
connections determine the parameter
group that is attached to your database
instance sign into the AWS Management
console and then open the Amazon RDS
console from the top right corner of the
Amazon RDS console choose the AWS region
of your database
instance in the navigation pane choose
databases and then choose a
configuration tab find the parameter
group in the section
in the list choose the parameter group
that you want to modify for parameter
group actions choose edit and set rd.
Force SSL parameter to true as you can
see I have already tested all those
steps and rebooted the
instance so encrypt specific connections
to encrypt connections from the SQL
Server management Studio launch SQL
Server management
Studio connect to server enter the
server information login username and
password choose option
select encrypt connection choose connect
confirm that your connection is
encrypted by running the following query
verify that the query returns true for
encryptor option and now you know how to
use SSL or TLS from your application to
encrypt a connection to an Amazon RDS
instance running either MySQL or SQL
Server thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
